intro: Phlegmariurus andinus, commonly known as the Andean haircap moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and its ability to thrive in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a dark green to reddish-brown color, with a distinctive, hair-like structure on its leaf margins. It is typically found in mountainous regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. Phlegmariurus andinus plays an important ecological role in soil stabilization and moisture retention in its native habitats.
